1.verse: The Lord Calls His People Back - In the eighth month [October/November on our calendar; the Hebrew month of Cheshvan] of the second year Darius was king [520 BC; Darius was king of Persia 522–486 BC], the ·LORD spoke his word [word of the LORD came] to the prophet Zechariah son of Berekiah, who was the son of Iddo [a priestly family; Neh. 12:4, 16]. The LORD said,

2.verse: “The LORD was very angry with your ·ancestors [fathers].

3.verse: So tell the people: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: ‘Return to me, and I will return to you,’ says the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts].

4.verse: Don’t be like your ·ancestors [fathers]. ·In the past the [The former/earlier] prophets said to them: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: ‘·Stop [Turn from] your evil ways and evil actions.’ But they wouldn’t listen or pay attention to me, says the LORD.

5.verse: Your ·ancestors [fathers] ·are dead [where are they…?], and those prophets ·didn’t [do they…?] live forever.

6.verse: I commanded my words and ·laws [statutes] to my servants the prophets, and ·they preached to [or they came true to; did they not overtake…?] your ·ancestors [fathers], who returned to me. They said, ‘The LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] did as he ·said he would [determined to do]. He punished us for ·the way we lived and for what we did [our ways and deeds].’”

7.verse: The Vision of the Horses - It was on the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month [February 15, 519 BC], which is the month of Shebat, in Darius’s second year as king [v. 1]. The ·LORD spoke his word [word of the LORD came] to the prophet Zechariah son of Berekiah, who was the son of Iddo.

8.verse: During the night I had a vision. I saw a man ·riding [or sitting on] a red horse. He was standing among some myrtle trees in a ravine, with red, brown, and white horses behind him [Rev. 6].

9.verse: I asked, “What are these, ·sir [or my lord]?” The ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me answered, “I’ll show you what they are.”

10.verse: Then the man standing among the myrtle trees explained, “They are the ones the LORD ·sent [sent to walk/patrol] through all the earth.”

11.verse: Then they spoke to the ·LORD’s angel [or angel of the LORD; an OT figure closely identified with the LORD himself; Gen. 16:11; 22:11–12], who was standing among the myrtle trees. They said, “We have ·gone [walked; patrolled] through all the earth, and [look; behold] everything is calm and quiet.”

12.verse: Then the ·LORD’s angel [angel of the LORD; v. 11] asked, “LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], how long will ·it be before you show [you withhold] mercy to Jerusalem and the cities of Judah? You have been angry with them for seventy years now.”

13.verse: So the LORD answered the ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me, and his words were comforting and good.

14.verse: Then the ·angel [messenger] who was talking to me said to me, “Announce this: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: ‘I ·have a strong love [am very jealous/zealous; Nah. 1:2] for Jerusalem.

15.verse: And I am very angry with the nations that feel so ·safe [secure; at ease]. I was only a little angry at them, but they ·made things worse [added to/increased the calamity/disaster].’

16.verse: “So this is what the LORD says: ‘I will return to Jerusalem with mercy. My ·Temple [house] will be rebuilt,’ says the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], ‘and the measuring line will be ·used to rebuild [stretched out over] Jerusalem.’

17.verse: “Also announce: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: ‘My towns will ·be rich again [overflow with prosperity]. The LORD will comfort Jerusalem again, and I will again choose Jerusalem.’”

18.verse: The Vision of the Horns - Then I looked up and saw four ·animal horns [horns; animal horns symbolized strength].

19.verse: I asked the ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me, “What are these?” He said, “These are the horns that scattered the people of Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.”

20.verse: Then the LORD showed me four craftsmen.

21.verse: I asked, “What are they coming to do?” He answered, “They have come to ·scare [terrify] and throw down the horns. These horns scattered the people of Judah so that no one could even lift up his head. These horns stand for the nations that ·attacked [lifted up their horns against] the people of Judah and scattered them.”

1.verse: The Vision of the Measuring Line - Then I looked up and saw a man holding a line for measuring things.

2.verse: I asked him, “Where are you going?” He said to me, “I am going to measure Jerusalem, to see how wide and how long it is.”

3.verse: Then the ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me left, and another ·angel [messenger] came out to meet him.

4.verse: The second ·angel [messenger] said to him, “Run and tell that young man, ‘Jerusalem will become a city without walls, because there will be so many people and ·cattle [livestock] in it.

5.verse: I will be a wall of fire around it,’ says the LORD. ‘And I will be the glory within it.’

6.verse: “·Oh no! Oh no [or Come! Come; or Up! Up]! Run away from ·Babylon [the land of the north], because I have scattered you like the four winds of heaven,” says the LORD.

7.verse: “·Oh no [or Come; or Up], ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple]! Escape, you who live in ·Babylon [Daughter Babylon].”

8.verse: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “After ·he has honored me and [or the Glorious One; or for his own glory he] sent me against the nations who ·took your possessions [plundered you]—because whoever touches you ·hurts [touches] ·what is precious to me [the apple of his eye; the pupil/little man of his eye]—

9.verse: I will ·shake my hand [raise my fist] against them so that their slaves will ·rob [plunder] them.” Then you will know that the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] sent me.

10.verse: “Shout and be glad, ·Jerusalem [Daughter Zion]. [For look/Behold] I am coming, and I will live among you,” says the LORD.

11.verse: “At that time people from many nations will join with the LORD and will become my people. Then I will live among you, and you will know that the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] has sent me to you.

12.verse: The LORD will ·take [possess; inherit] Judah as his own part of the holy land, and ·Jerusalem will be his chosen city again [will again choose Jerusalem].

13.verse: Be silent, ·everyone [all flesh], in the presence of the LORD. He ·is coming [has roused himself] out of ·the holy place where he lives [his holy dwelling].”

1.verse: The Vision of the High Priest - Then he showed me Joshua, the high priest, standing in front of the ·LORD’s angel [angel of the LORD; 1:11]. And ·Satan [or the Accuser/Adversary; Job 1–2; 1 Chr. 21:1] was standing by Joshua’s [Hag. 1:1] right ·side [hand] to accuse him.

2.verse: The LORD said to ·Satan [or the Accuser/Adversary], “The LORD ·says no to [rebuke] you, ·Satan [Adversary; Accuser]! The LORD who has chosen Jerusalem ·says no to [rebukes] you! ·This man was [Isn’t this man…?] like a burning stick ·pulled [snatched] from the fire.”

3.verse: Joshua was wearing ·dirty [filthy] clothes and was standing in front of the ·angel [messenger].

4.verse: The ·angel [messenger] said to those standing in front of him, “Take off those ·dirty [filthy] clothes.” Then ·the angel [he] said to Joshua, “Look, I have taken away your ·sin [iniquity] from you, and I am giving you beautiful, ·fine clothes [festal robes; fine vestments].”

5.verse: Then I said, “Put a clean turban on his head.” So they put a clean turban on his head and dressed him while the ·LORD’s angel [angel of the LORD; 1:11] stood there.

6.verse: Then the ·LORD’s angel [angel of the LORD; 1:11] ·said [spoke solemnly; gave this charge] to Joshua,

7.verse: “This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: ‘If you ·do as I tell you [walk in my ways] and ·serve me [carefully keep my requirements], you will be in charge of my ·Temple [house] and my courtyards. And I will let you be with ·these angels [these] who are standing here.

8.verse: “‘Listen, Joshua, the high priest, and your ·friends [colleagues; associates] who are sitting in front of you. They are ·symbols [a sign] of what will happen. [Look; Behold] I am going to bring my servant, the Branch [the Messiah; Ps. 132:17; Is. 11:1; 42:1; Jer. 23:5; 33:15].

9.verse: Look, I put this stone in front of Joshua, a stone with seven ·sides [eyes]. I will ·carve a message [engrave an inscription] on it,’ says the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts]. ‘And in one day I will ·take away the sin [remove the iniquity] of this land.’

10.verse: “The LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says, ‘In that day, each of you will invite your neighbor to sit under your own grapevine and under your own fig tree [symbols of security and prosperity; Is. 36:16; Mic. 4:4].’”

1.verse: The Vision of the Lampstand - Then the ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me returned and woke me up as if I had been asleep.

2.verse: He asked me, “What do you see?” I said, “I see a solid gold ·lampstand [menorah] with a bowl at the top. And there are seven lamps and also seven ·places [pipes; spouts] for wicks.

3.verse: There are two olive trees by it, one on the right of the bowl and the other on the left.”

4.verse: I asked the ·angel [messenger] who talked with me, “·Sir [My lord], what are these?”

5.verse: ·The angel [He] said, “Don’t you know what they are?” “No, sir,” I said.

6.verse: Then he told me, “This is the word of the LORD to Zerubbabel: ‘·You will not succeed by your own strength or by your own power [Not by might, nor by power], but by my Spirit,’ says the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts].

7.verse: “Who are you, ·big [mighty; great] mountain? ·In front of [Compared with] Zerubbabel you will become ·flat land [a level plain], and he will bring out the ·topmost stone [capstone], ·shouting [or amid shouting], ‘·It’s beautiful! It’s beautiful [or Blessings, Blessings upon it; Grace, Grace to it]!’”

8.verse: Then the ·LORD spoke his word [word of the LORD came] to me again, saying,

9.verse: “[The hands of] Zerubbabel has laid the foundation of this ·Temple [house; Ezra 3:7–13], and he will complete it [Ezra 6:13–18]. Then you will know that the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] has sent me to you.

10.verse: “·The people should not think that small beginnings are unimportant [For who despises the day of small things?]. ·They [or These seven eyes] will ·be happy [rejoice] when they see Zerubbabel with ·tools [or his plumb line; or the chosen capstone], building the Temple. “(These are the seven eyes of the LORD, which look back and forth across the earth.)”

11.verse: Then I asked the ·angel [messenger], “What are the two olive ·trees [or branches] on the right and left of the lampstand?”

12.verse: ·I also [or Again I] asked him, “What are the two olive branches beside the two gold pipes, from which the olive oil ·flows to the lamps [pours out]?”

13.verse: He answered, “Don’t you know what they are?” “No, ·sir [my lord],” I said.

14.verse: So he said, “They are symbols of the two ·who have been appointed to serve [anointed ones who stand by] the Lord of all the earth.”

1.verse: The Vision of the Flying Scroll - I ·looked up again [turned and lifted my eyes] and saw a flying scroll.

2.verse: ·The angel [He] asked me, “What do you see?” I answered, “I see a flying scroll, ·thirty feet [twenty cubits] long and ·fifteen feet [ten cubits] wide.”

3.verse: And he said to me, “This is the curse that ·will go [or is going out] all over the land. One side says every thief will be ·taken away [banished; purged]. The other side says everyone who ·makes false promises [swears falsely] will be ·taken away [banished; purged].

4.verse: The LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says, ‘I will send it to the houses of thieves and to those who ·use my name to make false promises [swear falsely]. The scroll will stay in that person’s house and destroy it with its wood and stones.’”

5.verse: The Vision of the Woman - Then the ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me came forward and said to me, “·Look up [Lift up your eyes] and see what is ·going out [or coming; appearing].”

6.verse: “What is it?” I asked. He answered, “It is a ·measuring basket [ephah] going out.” He also said, “It is ·a symbol of the people’s sins [their iniquity; or their appearance; their eye] in all the land.”

7.verse: Then the lid made of lead was raised, and there was a woman sitting inside the basket.

8.verse: The angel said, “The woman ·stands for [is] wickedness.” Then he pushed her back into the basket and put the lid back down.

9.verse: Then I ·looked up [lifted my eyes] and saw two women going out with the wind in their wings. Their wings were like those of a stork, and they lifted up the basket between earth and the ·sky [heaven].

10.verse: I asked the ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me, “Where are they taking the basket?”

11.verse: “They are going to Babylonia to build a ·temple [house] for it,” he answered. “When ·the temple [it] is ready, they will set the basket there ·in its place [or on its base/pedestal].”

1.verse: The Vision of the Four Chariots - I looked up again and saw four chariots ·going [coming] out between two mountains, mountains of bronze.

2.verse: Red horses pulled the first chariot. Black horses pulled the second chariot.

3.verse: White horses pulled the third chariot, and strong, ·spotted [dappled] horses pulled the fourth chariot.

4.verse: I asked the ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me, “What are these, sir?”

5.verse: He said, “These are the four spirits of heaven. They have just come from ·the presence of [or presenting themselves before] the Lord of the whole world.

6.verse: The chariot pulled by the black horses will go to the land of the north. The white horses will go ·to the land of the west [or after them], and the spotted horses will go to the land of the south.”

7.verse: When the powerful horses went out, they were ·eager [seeking] to go through all the earth. So he said, “Go ·through all [or and patrol] the earth,” and they did.

8.verse: Then he ·called [cried out] to me, “Look, the horses that went north have caused my ·spirit to rest [anger to be appeased; or Spirit to rest] in the land of the north.”

9.verse: A Crown for Joshua - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying,

10.verse: “Take silver and gold from Heldai, Tobijah, and Jedaiah, who were captives in Babylon. Go that same day to the house of Josiah son of Zephaniah, who came from Babylon [may refer to the three men rather than to Josiah].

11.verse: Make the silver and gold into a crown, and put it on the head of Joshua son of Jehozadak, the high priest.

12.verse: Tell him this is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: ‘A man whose name is the Branch [3:8] will branch out from where he is, and he will build the Temple of the LORD.

13.verse: It is he who will build the Temple of the LORD and will ·receive honor [or be clothed in splendor/majesty]. He will sit on his throne and rule [referring to Zerubbabel and ultimately to the Messiah]. And there will be a priest on his throne [referring to Joshua the high priest and ultimately to the Messiah]. And ·these two will work together in peace [the counsel of peace will be between the two].’

14.verse: The crown will be kept in the Temple of the LORD to remind ·Heldai [Helem; probably another name for Heldai], Tobijah, Jedaiah, and ·Josiah [Hen; perhaps a nickname for Josiah, meaning “gracious one”] son of Zephaniah.

15.verse: People living far away will come and build the Temple of the LORD. Then you will know the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] has sent me to you. This will happen if you completely obey the [voice of the] LORD your God.”

1.verse: The People Should Show Mercy - In the fourth year Darius was king, on the fourth day of the ninth month, which is called Kislev [December 7, 518 BC], the ·LORD spoke his word [word of the LORD came] to Zechariah.

2.verse: The city of Bethel sent Sharezer, Regem-Melech, and their men to ·ask the LORD a question [or seek the LORD’s favor].

3.verse: They went to the prophets and priests who were at the ·Temple [house] of the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts]. The men said, “For years in the fifth month of each year we have ·shown our sadness [mourned; wept] and fasted. Should we continue to do this?”

4.verse: The ·LORD All-Powerful spoke his word [word of the LORD All-Powerful/of Heaven’s Armies/of hosts came] to me, saying,

5.verse: “Tell the priests and the people in the land: ‘For seventy years you fasted and ·cried [mourned] in the fifth and seventh months, but ·that was not [was it…?] really for me.

6.verse: And when you ate and drank, ·it was really [was it not…?] for yourselves.

7.verse: Wasn’t this the same thing the LORD said through the ·earlier [former] prophets, when Jerusalem and the surrounding towns were at peace and wealthy, and people lived in the ·southern area [Negev] and the ·western hills [or lowland; Shephelah]?’”

8.verse: And the ·LORD spoke his word [word of the LORD came] to Zechariah again, saying,

9.verse: “This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: ‘·Do what is right and true [Administer true justice]. Be kind and ·merciful [compassionate] to each other.

10.verse: Don’t ·hurt [oppress] widows and ·orphans [the fatherless], foreigners or the poor [Ex. 22:21–24; 23:9; Lev. 19:33–34; Deut 24:17–18]; don’t ·even think of doing evil to [or secretly plot evil against] somebody else.’

11.verse: “But they refused to pay attention; they ·were stubborn [turned their backs; gave a stubborn shoulder] and ·did not want to listen anymore [covered their ears].

12.verse: They made their hearts ·as hard as rock [like flint] and would not listen to the ·teachings [law; Torah] of the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts]. And they would not hear the words he sent by his Spirit through the earlier prophets. So the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] became very angry.

13.verse: “‘When I called to them, they would not listen. So when they called to me, I would not listen,’ says the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts].

14.verse: ‘I scattered them like a ·hurricane [whirlwind] ·to other countries [among all the nations] they did not know. This good land was left so ·ruined behind them [desolate] that no one ·could live there [or traveled through it]. They had made the ·desired [pleasant] land ·a ruin [desolate; a wasteland].’”

1.verse: The Lord Will Bless Jerusalem - ·A message from [The word of] the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] came to me, saying,

2.verse: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “I ·have a very strong love [am jealous/zealous/passionate] for ·Jerusalem [Zion; 2:7]. My strong love [jealousy; zeal; passion] for her ·is like a fire burning in me [or will mean wrath for her enemies].”

3.verse: This is what the LORD says: “I will return to Jerusalem and ·live in [dwell in the midst of] it. Then it will be called the City of ·Truth [or Faithfulness], and the mountain of the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] will be called the Holy Mountain [Zion, the location of the Temple].”

4.verse: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “Old men and old women will again sit along Jerusalem’s streets, each carrying a cane because of age [long life due to peace and security].

5.verse: And the streets will be filled with boys and girls playing.”

6.verse: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “·Those who are left alive then [The remnant] may think it is too ·difficult [marvelous] to happen, but ·it is not [is it…?] too ·difficult [marvelous] for me,” says the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts].

7.verse: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “[Look; Behold] I will save my people from countries in the east and west.

8.verse: I will bring them back, and they will live in Jerusalem. They will be my people, and I will be their ·loyal [faithful; true] and ·good [righteous] God.”

9.verse: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “·Work hard [Let your hands be strong], you who are hearing these words today. The prophets spoke these words when the foundation was laid for the house of the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], for the building of the Temple.

10.verse: Before that time there was no money to hire people or animals. People could not ·safely [peacefully] come and go because of the enemies; I had turned everyone against his neighbor.

11.verse: But I will not do to ·these people who are left [this remnant of the people] what I did in the past,” says the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts].

12.verse: “They will plant their seeds in peace, their grapevines will have fruit, the ground will give good crops, and the sky will send ·rain [dew]. I will give ·all this [this as an inheritance/possession] to the ·people who are left alive [remnant of this people].

13.verse: Judah and Israel, your names have been ·used as curses in [or viewed as accursed by] other nations. But I will save you, and you will become a blessing. So don’t be afraid; ·work hard [let your hands be strong].”

14.verse: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “When your ·ancestors [fathers] made me angry, I planned to ·punish [bring disaster on] you. I did not ·change my mind [relent],” says the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts].

15.verse: “But ·now [in these days] I am planning to do good to Jerusalem and Judah. So don’t be afraid.

16.verse: These are the things you should do: Tell each other the truth. In ·the courts [your gates; court was held at the city gate] judge with truth and ·complete fairness [sound justice; judgments of peace].

17.verse: Do not ·make plans to hurt [plan/plot evil in your hearts against] your neighbors, and don’t love false ·promises [oaths]. I hate all these things,” says the LORD.

18.verse: ·A message from [The word of the] LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] came to me again.

19.verse: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “The ·special days when you fast in [fasts of] the fourth, fifth, seventh, and tenth months will become good, joyful, happy feasts ·in [for the house of] Judah. ·But you must [So; Therefore] love truth and peace.”

20.verse: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “·Many people from [Inhabitants of] many cities will still come to Jerusalem.

21.verse: ·People [The inhabitants] from one city will go and say to those from another city, ‘·We are going [Let us go] to ·pray to [entreat] the LORD and to ·ask for help from [or worship; seek] the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts]. ·Come and go with us [I, even I (am going)].’

22.verse: Many people and powerful nations will come to worship the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] in Jerusalem and to ·pray for help from [or worship; seek] the LORD.”

23.verse: This is what the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “At that time, ten men from ·different countries [all languages of the nations] will come and take hold of a ·Judean [Jew] by his coat. They will say to him, ‘Let us go with you, because we have heard that God is with you.’”

1.verse: Punishment on Israel’s Enemies - ·This message is [An oracle/burden of] the word of the LORD. The message is against the land of Hadrach [region north of Israel] and ·the city of Damascus [Damascus its resting place]. ·All [For the eyes of all] people, including all the tribes of Israel ·belong to [or are on] the LORD.

2.verse: The message is also against the city of Hamath, on the border, and against Tyre and Sidon [cities on the coast northwest of Israel], ·with their skill [or though they are very wise/clever].

3.verse: Tyre has built a ·strong wall [fortress; stronghold] for herself. She has piled up silver like dust and gold like the mud in the streets.

4.verse: But [look; behold] the Lord will take away all she has and ·destroy her power on [or throw her fortifications into] the sea. That city will be ·destroyed [consumed; devoured] by fire.

5.verse: ·The city of Ashkelon [Ashkelon] will see it and be afraid. ·The people of Gaza [Gaza] will ·shake with fear [writhe in anguish], and ·the people of Ekron [Ekron] ·will lose hope [or their hope will wither]. No king will be left in Gaza, and no one will live in Ashkelon anymore.

6.verse: ·Foreigners [A mixed/mongrel people] will live in Ashdod, and I will ·destroy [cut off] the pride of the Philistines.

7.verse: I will ·stop them from drinking blood [take the blood from their mouths; Lev. 3:17; Deut. 12:16, 23] and ·from eating forbidden food [its abominations from between its teeth]. Those left alive will belong to God. They will be ·leaders [or like a clan] in Judah, and Ekron will become like the Jebusites [ancient inhabitants of Jerusalem who were assimilated into Judah].

8.verse: I will ·protect [encamp around] my ·Temple [house] from armies who would come or go. No ·one [oppressor] will ·hurt [overrun; pass over] my people again, because now I ·am watching them [see with my eyes].

9.verse: The King Is Coming - Rejoice greatly, ·people of Jerusalem [Daughter Zion]! Shout for joy, ·people of Jerusalem [Daughter Jerusalem]! [Look; Behold] Your king is coming to you. He ·does what is right [is righteous/just], and he saves. He is ·gentle [lowly; humble] and riding on a donkey, on ·the colt [a colt, the foal] of a donkey [Matt. 21:5; John 12:15].

10.verse: I will ·take away [cut off] the chariots from Ephraim and the ·horses [warhorses] from Jerusalem. The bows used in war will be broken. The king will ·talk about [announce; bring] peace to the nations. His ·kingdom [dominion; rule] will go from sea to sea, and from the ·Euphrates River [River] to the ends of the earth.

11.verse: As for you, because of the blood of ·the agreement [my covenant/treaty] with you I will set your prisoners free from the waterless pit.

12.verse: You prisoners who have hope, return to ·your place of safety [the fortress/stronghold]. Today I ·am telling you [announce; declare] that I will ·give you back twice as much as before [return double what you lost].

13.verse: I will ·use [bend] Judah like a bow and Ephraim like the arrows. ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple], I will ·use your men [rouse your sons/children] ·to fight the men of [against your sons/children,] Greece. I will use you like a warrior’s sword.

14.verse: Then the LORD will appear above them, and his arrows will shoot like lightning. The Lord GOD will blow the trumpet, and he will march in the ·storms [whirlwinds] of the south.

15.verse: The LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] will protect them; they will ·destroy [eat and subdue] the enemy with slingshots. They will drink and shout like drunks. They will be filled like a bowl used for sprinkling blood ·at [or and drenched with blood like] the corners of the altar.

16.verse: On that day the LORD their God will save them as ·if his people were sheep [the flock of his people]. They will shine in his land like jewels in a crown.

17.verse: They will be so ·pretty [fine; good] and beautiful. The young men will grow strong on the grain and the young women on new wine.

1.verse: The Lord’s Promises - Ask the LORD for rain during the ·springtime [latter] rains. The LORD is the one who makes the storm clouds. He sends the showers and gives everyone ·green [plants in the] fields.

2.verse: ·Idols [Household gods; Teraphim; Gen. 31:19] ·tell lies [or give worthless counsel]; fortune-tellers see ·false [lying] visions and tell about false dreams. The comfort they give is ·worth nothing [in vain]. So the people ·are [wander] like lost sheep. They are ·abused [oppressed; or in distress], because there is no shepherd.

3.verse: The LORD says, “·I am angry [My anger burns] at my shepherds, and I will punish the ·leaders [lead goats]. I, the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], care for my flock, the ·people [house] of Judah. I will make them like my ·proud [majestic] war horses.

4.verse: From ·Judah [him] will come the cornerstone, and the tent peg, the battle bow, and every ruler.

5.verse: Together they will be like ·soldiers [mighty men] ·marching to battle [or trampling their enemies] through muddy streets. The LORD is with them, so they will fight and ·defeat [put to shame] the horsemen.

6.verse: “I will strengthen the ·people [house] of Judah and save the ·people [house] of Joseph. I will bring them back, because I ·care about [have compassion on] them. It will be as though I had never ·left [rejected] them, because I am the LORD their God, and I will ·answer [hear] them.

7.verse: The people of Ephraim will be strong like ·soldiers [mighty men]; ·they will be glad [their hearts will rejoice] as when they have drunk wine. Their children will see it and rejoice; they will ·be happy [rejoice] in the LORD.

8.verse: I will ·call [signal/whistle for] my people and gather them together. I will ·save [redeem] them, and they grow as numerous as they were before.

9.verse: I have scattered them among the nations, but in those faraway places, they will remember me. They and their children will ·live [survive; sprout forth] and return.

10.verse: I will bring them back from the land of Egypt and gather them from Assyria. I will bring them to Gilead and Lebanon until there isn’t enough room for them all.

11.verse: ·They [or The LORD; He] will come through the sea of trouble [as at the Red/or Reed Sea; Ex. 14:22]. The waves of the sea will be calm, and the ·Nile River [depths of the Nile/River] will dry up. I will ·defeat [bring down; humble] Assyria’s pride and destroy Egypt’s ·power over other countries [scepter; ruling authority].

12.verse: I will make my people strong [in the LORD], and they will ·live as I say [walk in my name],” says the LORD.

1.verse: Lebanon, open your ·gates [doors] so fire may ·burn [consume; devour] your cedar trees.

2.verse: ·Cry [Wail], pine trees, because the cedar has fallen, because the ·tall [majestic; glorious] trees are ruined. ·Cry [Wail], oaks in Bashan, because the ·mighty [thick; dense] forest has been cut down [trees probably symbolize wicked rulers].

3.verse: Listen to the shepherds ·crying [wailing] because their ·rich pastures [or glory; magnificence] are destroyed. Listen to the lions roaring because the ·lovely land [lush thicket] of the Jordan River is ruined.

4.verse: The Two Shepherds - This is what the LORD my God says: “·Feed [Shepherd] the flock that are ·about to be killed [set aside for slaughter].

5.verse: Their buyers ·kill [slaughter] them and ·are not punished [are not held liable; or feel no remorse]. Those who sell them say, ‘·Praise [Blessed be] the LORD, I am rich.’ Even the shepherds don’t ·feel sorry for [have compassion on; or spare] their sheep.

6.verse: I don’t ·feel sorry [have compassion] anymore for the ·people [inhabitants] of this country,” says the LORD. “I will let everyone ·be under the power [fall into the hand] of his neighbor and king. They will ·bring trouble to [devastate] the country, and I will not save anyone from ·them [their hand].”

7.verse: So I ·fed [shepherded] the flock ·about to be killed [marked for slaughter], particularly the ·weakest [oppressed] ones. Then I took two ·sticks [staffs]; I called one ·Pleasant [or Favor] and the other Union, and I ·fed [shepherded] the flock.

8.verse: In one month I got rid of three shepherds. The flock ·did not pay attention to [or detested; loathed] me, and I ·got impatient [grew weary] with them.

9.verse: I said, “I will no longer ·take care of you like a shepherd [shepherd you]. Let those that are dying die, and let those that are ·to be destroyed be destroyed [perishing perish]. Let those that are left eat ·each other [the flesh of his neighbor].”

10.verse: Then I broke the ·stick [staff] named ·Pleasant [or Favor] to ·break [revoke] the ·agreement [covenant; treaty] God made with all the ·nations [peoples].

11.verse: That day it was ·broken [revoked]. The ·weak [oppressed] ones in the flock who were watching me knew this ·message was from [was the word of] the LORD.

12.verse: Then I said, “If ·you want [it seems right to you; it is good in your eyes] to pay me, pay me. If not, ·then don’t [keep it].” So they ·paid [weighed out to] me thirty pieces of silver [Ex. 21:32; Matt. 26:15].

13.verse: The LORD said to me, “Throw the money to the potter.” ·That is how little they thought I was worth […this magnificent price at which they valued me”; sarcastic, since the sum was about the cost of a slave]. So I took the thirty pieces of silver and threw them to the potter in the ·Temple [house] of the LORD [Matt. 27:9, 10].

14.verse: Then I broke the second ·stick [staff], named Union, to break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.

15.verse: Then the LORD said to me, “·Get the things used by a foolish shepherd again,

16.verse: because [look; behold] I am going to ·get [raise up] a new shepherd for the country. He will not care for the ·dying sheep [lost; perishing], or look for the young ones, or heal the injured ones, or feed the healthy. But he will ·eat [devour the flesh of] the ·best [fat] sheep and tear off their hoofs.

17.verse: “·How terrible it will be for [Woe to] the ·useless [worthless] shepherd who abandoned the flock. A sword will strike his arm and his right eye. His arm will ·lose all its strength [wither away], and his right eye will go blind.”

1.verse: Jerusalem Will Be Saved - ·This message is [The oracle/burden of] the word of the LORD ·to [or concerning] Israel. This is what the LORD says, who stretched out the ·skies [heavens], and laid the foundations of the earth [Gen. 1], and ·put [forms] the human spirit within:

2.verse: “I will make Jerusalem like a cup of ·poison [staggering; reeling; drunkenness] to the nations around her. They will come and ·attack [besiege] Jerusalem and Judah.

3.verse: ·One [And it shall be on that] day all the nations on earth will come together to attack Jerusalem, but I will make it like a ·heavy [immovable] rock; anyone who tries to ·move [carry] it will ·get hurt [be injured].

4.verse: At that time I will ·confuse [strike with panic] every horse and cause its rider to go crazy,” says the LORD. “I will ·watch over [open my eyes to] the ·people [house] of Judah, but I will blind all the horses of the ·enemies [nations; peoples].

5.verse: Then the ·leaders [or clans] of Judah will say to themselves, ‘The ·people [inhabitants] of Jerusalem are strong, because the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] is their God.’

6.verse: “At that time I will make the ·leaders [or clans] of Judah like a ·fire burning [firepot on] a stack of wood or like a ·fire burning straw [burning torch among sheaves]. They will ·destroy [consume; devour] all the people around them left and right. But the people of Jerusalem will remain ·safe [settled in their place].

7.verse: “The LORD will save the ·homes [tents] of Judah first so that the ·honor given to [glory of] ·David’s family [the house of David] and to the people of Jerusalem won’t be greater than the ·honor given to [glory of] Judah [the defenseless countryside would be saved before the fortified city, showing the victory was due to the LORD].

8.verse: ·At that time [On that day] the LORD will ·protect [defend] the people in Jerusalem. Then even the weakest of them will be strong like David. And the ·family [house] of David will be like God, like ·an [or the] angel of the LORD in front of them [Gen. 48:16; Ex. 14:19; 23:20].

9.verse: ·At that time [On that day] I will ·go [set out; begin] to destroy all the nations that attack Jerusalem.

10.verse: Crying for the One They Pierced - “I will pour out on ·David’s family [the house of David] and the ·people in [inhabitants of] Jerusalem a spirit of ·kindness [grace] and ·mercy [prayer; supplication]. They will look at me, the one they have ·stabbed [pierced], and they will ·cry [mourn/lament for him] like someone ·crying [mourning; lamenting] over the death of an only ·child [son]. They will ·be as sad [grieve bitterly] as someone who has lost a firstborn son.

11.verse: ·At that time [On that day] there will be much crying in Jerusalem, like the crying for Hadad Rimmon in the plain of Megiddo [either where Judah mourned the death of king Josiah (2 Chr. 35:25), or ritualistic mourning associated with the Canaanite storm god (Ezek. 8:14; 2 Kin. 5:18)].

12.verse: The land will ·cry [mourn], each ·family [clan] by itself: the ·family [clan] of [the house of] David by itself and their wives by themselves, the ·family [clan] of Nathan [2 Sam. 5:14] by itself and their wives by themselves,

13.verse: the ·family [clan] of Levi [Num. 3:17–18, 21] by itself and their wives by themselves, the ·family [clan] of Shimei [a clan of Levites; Ex. 6:16–17] by itself and their wives by themselves,

14.verse: and all the rest of the ·families [clans] by themselves and their wives by themselves.

1.verse: “·At that time [In that day] a fountain will be open for ·David’s descendants [the house of David] and for the ·people [inhabitants] of Jerusalem to cleanse them of their sin and ·uncleanness [impurity; defilement].”

2.verse: The LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says, “·At that time [On that day] I will ·get rid of [remove; cut off] the names of the idols from the land; no one will remember them anymore. I will also remove the prophets and ·unclean spirits [or spirit of uncleanness/impurity] from the land [unlike true prophecy from the Spirit of God].

3.verse: If a person continues to prophesy, his own father and mother, the ones who gave birth to him, will tell him, ‘You have told lies ·using [in] the LORD’s name, so you must die.’ When he prophesies, his own father and mother who gave birth to him will ·stab [pierce] him.

4.verse: “·At that time [On that day] the prophets will be ashamed of their visions and prophecies. They won’t wear the prophet’s clothes made of hair [like Elijah (1 Kin. 19:13) and Elisha (1 Kin. 19:19); cf. John the Baptist (Matt. 3:4)] to ·trick [deceive] people.

5.verse: Each of them will say, ‘I am not a prophet. I am a farmer ·and have been a farmer since I was young [for a man sold me in my youth; as an indentured servant to work the land].’

6.verse: But someone will ask, ‘What are the ·deep cuts [wounds] ·on your body [or on your chest; between your hands; pagan prophets often cut themselves to appeal to their gods]?’ And each will answer, ‘I was ·hurt [wounded] at my friend’s house.’

7.verse: The Shepherd Is Killed - “·Sword, hit the [Awake, Sword, against my] shepherd. ·Attack […against] the man who is my ·friend [associate],” says the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts]. “·Kill [Strike] the shepherd, and the sheep will scatter [Matt. 26:31; Mark 14:27], and I will ·punish [turn my hand against] the little ones.”

8.verse: The LORD says, “Two-thirds of the people through all the land will die. They will be ·gone [struck down; cut off], and one-third will be left.

9.verse: The third that is left I will ·test with [bring into the] fire, ·purifying [refining] them like silver, testing them like gold. Then they will call on ·me [my name], and I will answer them. I will say, ‘These are my people,’ and they will say, ‘The LORD is our God.’”

1.verse: The Day of Punishment - The ·LORD’s day of judging [day of the LORD; Zeph. 1:7] is coming when ·the wealth you have taken [your plunder] will be divided ·among you [in your midst; or right in front of you; while you watch].

2.verse: I will bring all the nations together to ·fight [wage war against] Jerusalem. They will capture the city and ·rob [plunder; loot] the houses and ·attack [rape] the women. Half the people will be taken away ·as captives [into exile], but the rest of the people won’t be taken from the city.

3.verse: Then the LORD will go to war against those nations; he will fight as in a day of battle.

4.verse: On that day ·he [his feet] will stand on the Mount of Olives, east of Jerusalem. The Mount of Olives will split in two, forming a deep valley that runs east and west. Half the mountain will move toward the north, and half will move toward the south.

5.verse: You will ·run [flee] through this mountain valley, for it will extend to Azel [unknown location east of Jerusalem]. You will run just as you did from the earthquake when Uzziah was king of Judah [Amos 1:1]. Then the LORD my God will come and all the holy ones [either angels or believers; Matt. 25:31; 1 Thess. 3:13; Jude 14; Rev. 19:14] with him.

6.verse: On that day there will be no light, ·cold, or frost [or the sources of lights will diminish].

7.verse: There will be no other day like it, ·and the LORD knows when it will come [a day known to the LORD]. There will be no day or night; even at evening it will still be light.

8.verse: At that time ·fresh [bubbling; or living; life-giving] water will flow from Jerusalem. Half of it will flow east to the ·Dead [eastern] Sea, and half will flow west to the ·Mediterranean [western] Sea. It will flow summer and winter.

9.verse: Then the LORD will be king over the whole world. ·At that time [On that day] ·there will be only one LORD [the LORD will be one; Deut. 6:4–5], and his name ·will be the only name [one].

10.verse: All the land south of Jerusalem from Geba [six miles northeast of Jerusalem, the northern boundary of Judah] to ·Rimmon [thirty-five miles southwest of Jerusalem] will be ·turned into a plain [or like the Arabah; the Jordan Valley, from Mount Hermon to the Gulf of Aqaba]. Jerusalem will be raised up, but it will stay in the same place. The city will reach from the Benjamin Gate and to the First Gate to the Corner Gate, and from the Tower of Hananel to the king’s winepresses.

11.verse: People will live there, and it will never be destroyed again. Jerusalem will ·be safe [dwell in security].

12.verse: But the LORD will bring a terrible ·disease [plague] on the nations that fought against Jerusalem. Their flesh will rot away while they are still standing up. Their eyes will rot in their sockets, and their tongues will rot in their mouths.

13.verse: ·At that time [On that day] the LORD will cause panic. Everybody will grab ·his [the hand of his] neighbor, and they will ·attack each other [raise his hand against the hand of his neighbor].

14.verse: ·The people of Judah [Judah] will fight in Jerusalem. And the wealth of the nations around them will be collected—much gold, silver, and clothes.

15.verse: A similar ·disease [plague] will strike the horses, mules, camels, donkeys, and all the animals in the camps.

16.verse: All of those left alive of the ·people [nations] who came to fight Jerusalem will come back to Jerusalem year after year to worship the King, the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], and to celebrate the Feast of ·Shelters [Booths; Tabernacles; Deut. 31:9–13].

17.verse: Anyone from the nations who does not go to Jerusalem to worship the King, the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], will not have rain fall on his land.

18.verse: If the Egyptians do not go to Jerusalem, they will not have rain. Then the LORD will send them the same ·terrible disease [plague] he sent the other nations that did not celebrate the Feast of ·Shelters [Booths; Tabernacles].

19.verse: This will be the punishment for Egypt and any nation that does not go up to celebrate the Feast of Shelters.

20.verse: ·At that time [On that day] the horses’ bells will have written on them: HOLY TO THE LORD. The cooking pots in the Temple of the Lord will be like the holy altar bowls.

21.verse: Every pot in Jerusalem and Judah will be holy to the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], and everyone who offers sacrifices will be able to take food from them and cook in them. ·At that time [On that day] there will not be any ·buyers or sellers [or Canaanite] in the Temple of the LORD [Matt. 21:12–13; John 2:13–16] ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts].
